import React from 'react'; import './style.css'; import Collapsible from 'react-collapsible'; const Adventure = () => { return (
We know this is a bit of a destination wedding for most of our guests, but we really wanted to be able to share a region we love so much with everyone else. If time allows, we encourage you to take some time to explore the region that has brought us so much joy over the numerous trips weve taken up there.
Below is an extensive list of the things to see, do, eat, and drink that we hope will be helpful for you in planning your own Central Coast adventure!
Big Sur
{/* Arroyo Grande */}
SUMMARY TITLE HERE
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog and then the sleepy cat wakes up and goes over to the window to look at the cute otter twiisting around in the beautiful bay.
    AGRARIAN HOTEL
    9.4
    $280-$320/night
    This newly renovated hotel is located right in Arroyo Grande and directly next-door to the Mason Bar. We stayed here in May and while it doesnt come with many frills or views, it is nice, clean, and conveniently located. We have a block of hotel rooms reserved here so if you are interested into booking one of them, you can call the hotel directly and let them know you staying there for our wedding.
    OXFORD SUITES
    8.6
    $250/night
    A more moderately priced hotel option for Pismo, but it is not on the water. [MIGHT HAVE DISCOUNT]
    SHORE CLIFF
    9.2
    $360-415/night
    One of the more reasonably priced hotels on the cliffs with the drawback being that is about a mile north of downtown Pismo. We havent stayed here before, but it has good reviews and offers special rates for guests at weddings. Call directly to book with the discounted wedding rate.
    SEACREST
    9.2
    $400-550/night
    While we cant vouch for all the rooms, we stayed here once in a room with a sweeping ocean view, balcony, and giant jacuzzi in the room and we loved it. [Call directly to book with the discounted wedding rate.]
    PISMO LIGHTHOUSE SUITES
    9.4
    $400-550/night
    Another very good option if you want to stay right on the water. They dont do wedding blocks, but they do have a special wedding rate so call directly to book with that discount.
    INN AT THE PIER
    8.6
    $500-700/night
    Upscale hotel right on the pier in Pismo Beach.
    VESPERA BY MARRIOT
    8.6
    $600-800/night
    Very new and swanky hotel located on the water in downtown Pismo for those who have a lot of Marriot points.
    AGRARIAN HOTEL
    9.4
    $280-$320/night
    This newly renovated hotel is located right in Arroyo Grande and directly next-door to the Mason Bar. We stayed here in May and while it doesnt come with many frills or views, it is nice, clean, and conveniently located. We have a block of hotel rooms reserved here so if you are interested into booking one of them, you can call the hotel directly and let them know you staying there for our wedding.
    AGRARIAN HOTEL
    9.4
    $280-$320/night
    This newly renovated hotel is located right in Arroyo Grande and directly next-door to the Mason Bar. We stayed here in May and while it doesnt come with many frills or views, it is nice, clean, and conveniently located. We have a block of hotel rooms reserved here so if you are interested into booking one of them, you can call the hotel directly and let them know you staying there for our wedding.
{/* Pismo Beach */}
PISMO BEACH
10 minutes from shuttle lot
A combination of swanky, grungy, and touristy, Pismo is located atop cliffs that overlook the ocean. There is a pier along with numerous dining options and while it certainly attracts a large variety of guests, the view is pretty spectacular.
    OXFORD SUITES
    8.6
    $250/night
    A more moderately priced hotel option for Pismo, but it is not on the water. [MIGHT HAVE DISCOUNT]
    SHORE CLIFF
    9.2
    $360-415/night
    One of the more reasonably priced hotels on the cliffs with the drawback being that is about a mile north of downtown Pismo. We havent stayed here before, but it has good reviews and offers special rates for guests at weddings. Call directly to book with the discounted wedding rate.
    SEACREST
    9.2
    $400-550/night
    While we cant vouch for all the rooms, we stayed here once in a room with a sweeping ocean view, balcony, and giant jacuzzi in the room and we loved it. [Call directly to book with the discounted wedding rate.]
    PISMO LIGHTHOUSE SUITES
    9.4
    $400-550/night
    Another very good option if you want to stay right on the water. They dont do wedding blocks, but they do have a special wedding rate so call directly to book with that discount.
    INN AT THE PIER
    8.6
    $500-700/night
    Upscale hotel right on the pier in Pismo Beach.
    VESPERA BY MARRIOT
    8.6
    $600-800/night
    Very new and swanky hotel located on the water in downtown Pismo for those who have a lot of Marriot points.
{/* Avila Beach */}
AVILA BEACH
20 minutes from shuttle lot
A small beach town located in a little cove that is quieter and more upscale than Pismo in terms of bars and restaurants, but it is still right on the ocean, so it draws a decent daytime beach crowd.
    AVILA VILLAGE INN
    9.0
    $400-500/night
    We stayed here once and thought it was really lovely. Its not walking distance from anything, but it is still pretty centrally located overall.
    AVILA LA FONDA
    9.6
    $450+/night
    Boutique hotel located right in Avila beach that looks really nice.
    INN AT AVILA
    N/A
    $390-510/night
    Boutique hotel located right in Avila beach that looks really nice.
{/* Santa Maria */}
SANTA MARIA
20 minutes from shuttle lot
With much more of a suburbia feel, Santa Maria is located more inland than the rest of the options. While it does not boast much to do in the town itself, it does have the cheapest adventure, is close to Orcutt which has some cool bars/restaurants, and is adjacent to the Santa Maria AVA.
    HAMPTON INN
    9.2
    $190/night
    Economical option right off the 101 in Santa Maria.
    FAIRFIELD INN
    8.6
    $170/night
    Economical option right off the 101 in Santa Maria.
    HISTORIC SANTA MARIA
    8.0
    $150/night
    This is an old hotel right in downtown Santa Maria. We stayed there once and while it was certainly passed its heyday, it was fine.
{/* San Luis Obispo */}
SAN LUIS OBISPO
20 minutes from shuttle lot
SLO is a college town with a delightful river walk running through it. While it is less touristy than the beach towns, it offers the widest array of dining options and should be free off all the college hooligans from Cal Poly in July.
    PETIT SOLEIL
    N/A
    $260-320/night
    European style B&B within easy walking distance of downtown. Looks very quaint but got decent reviews.
    LA QUINTA
    9.0
    $270/night
    We stayed here a couple years back because we saw it had been newly renovated and we thought was pretty nice for a La Quinta. While it is a mile walk from downtown, it is located right next to 1865 Craft House which has yummy food and drink. We are trying to see if they have any special wedding rates so if you are thinking you want to stay here, check back for more details.
    BUTLER HOTEL
    N/A
    $279/night
    This is a very small, but intriguingly trendy option in SLO that we stumbled across (its not on hotels.com). While it's not in the main downtown area, it is still easy walking distance most of the bars and restaurants.
    THE KINNEY
    8.8
    $280/night
    Another economical, yet trendy hotel a mile down the street from downtown SLO.
    MADONNA INN
    9.0
    $300-450/night
    If you are looking for a grand adventure with your adventure, then look no further than the Madonna Inn. The Madonna will be one of the more unique stays of your entire life as every room has an outrageous theme and the bar/dining room are decorated in a way thats best to left to experience on your own. From personal experience, we would recommend the Rock Bottom, Irish Hills, or Gypsy Rock rooms however the Cabin Still, Caveman, Yahoo, Swiss Belle, or Yosemite Rock have always piqued our interest. We also highly recommend their spa.
    COURTYARD BY MARRIOT
    8.8
    $320/night
    If you have Starwood points, this is a Marriott option. It is well outside of downtown SLO and outside of the Taco Temple, it is not walking distance from anything.
    GARDEN STREET INN
    9.2
    $350/night
    Upscale bed and breakfast located right in downtown SLO.
    SAN LUIS CREEK
    9.4
    $380-410/night
    Very small boutique hotel right just outside downtown SLO
    HOTEL CERO
    9.2
    $430/night
    Nice boutique hotel right in downtown SLO
    SLO BREW LOFTS
    9.2
    $650-850/night - 2br/3br
    We have always been curious about these as they look really nice and are located right in the middle of downtown SLO, but we've never had the chance to stay there. They are best suited for a groups that want to stay together and are right above a brewery which is always a plus.
View Hotels on a map
Air Bnbs
{/* AirBnbs */}
There is a pretty wide array of Airbnb selections in the area and weve found that they tend to be more affordable options than hotels especially if you are sharing it friends/family. We put together a list on Airbnb and VRBO of some of our recommendations.
AIRBNB LIST
VRBO LIST
**Note that some Airbnbs havent opened up their availability for next summer yet so if you dont see anywhere you are ready to commit to today, there might be more might open up later in the year.
); }; export default Adventure;
